data.enText: to say that you will cause trouble, hurt sb, etc. if you do not get what you want
They broke my windows and threatened me.
data.chText: 他们砸碎我的窗子并威胁我。

data.enText: The attacker threatened them with a gun.
He was threatened with dismissal if he continued to turn up late for work.
data.chText: 他受到警告，如果继续上班迟到，就被辞退。

data.enText: The threatened strike has been called off.
data.chText: 扬言要进行的罢工被取消了。

data.enText: The hijackers threatened to kill one passenger every hour if their demands were not met.
data.chText: 劫机者要挟说，如果他们的要求得不到满足，他们每过一小时就杀死一名乘客。

data.enText: to seem likely to happen or cause sth unpleasant
This dispute threatens to split the party.
data.chText: 这一分歧可能会造成党的分裂。
乌云密布预示大雨将至。

data.enText: to be a danger to sth

simple_means.memory_skill: threat n.威胁 + -en 动词后缀

ex.enText: The boss threatened to fire him.
Her father threatened to turn her out of doors.
ex.chText: 她的父亲扬言要赶她出门。

ex.enText: The workers threatened a strike if the company refused to raise their pay.
ex.chText: 如果公司拒绝增加工资，工人们威胁要罢工。

synonyms.bx: 尤指以威胁或恐吓的方式胁迫某人做或不做某事，含如不服从将会有严重后果之意。

ex.enText: The robber menaced him with a revolver.
ex.chText: 歹徒用左轮手枪威吓他。
这些措施威胁着他们的自由。

ex.enText: Many wild animals are still menaced by poachers.
ex.chText: 许多野生动物仍然面临非法捕猎者的威胁。

synonyms.bx: 多指用目光、行动、武器等对别人进行恐吓，而不是用语言明白地表示出来。

ex.enText: A war would endanger millions of lives.
ex.chText: 战争会危及无数人的生命。

synonyms.bx: 指使人或事物遭受危险、破坏等。

ex.enText: The security of the nation was imperiled/endangered.
The flood imperiled/endangered the villagers' lives.
ex.chText: 洪水危及到村民的生命。

synonyms.bx: 可与 endanger 换用，但更强调未来的危险。

ex.enText: This scandal threatens to ruin his chances in the election.
ex.chText: 这桩丑闻威胁到他的竞选前途。

synonyms.bx: 指对人或事物构成威胁。

tr: to utter intentions of injury or punishment against:"He threatened me when I tried to call the police"
to be a menacing indication of something:"The clouds threaten rain"

example: The pollution is endangering the crops

example.ex: He said army officers had threatened to destroy the town...
example.tran: 他说陆军军官们曾威胁要摧毁那座小镇。

example.ex: He tied her up and threatened her with a six-inch knife...
example.tran: 他把她捆起来，拿着一把 6 英寸长的刀子威胁她。

example.ex: If you threaten me or use any force, I shall inform the police.
example.tran: 你要是威胁我或是动武，我就报警。

value.def: If a person threatens to do something unpleasant to you, or if they threaten you, they say or imply that they will do something unpleasant to you, especially if you do not do what they want.

example.ex: The newcomers directly threaten the livelihood of the established workers...
example.tran: 新来的工人直接威胁到老工人的饭碗。

example.ex: The unity of our society is threatened by troublesome and restless minorities...
example.tran: 我们社会的团结遭到了一小撮滋扰生事、不安分守己的群体的威胁。

example.ex: 30 percent of reptiles, birds, and fish are currently threatened with extinction.
example.tran: 目前，30% 的爬行动物、鸟类和鱼类面临灭绝的危险。

value.def: If something or someone threatens a person or thing, they are likely to harm that person or thing.

example.ex: The fighting is threatening to turn into full-scale war...
example.tran: 这场战斗有可能会演变为全面的战争。

example.ex: Plants must be covered with a leaf-mould or similarly protected if frost threatens.
example.tran: 如果霜冻来临，植物必须盖上腐叶土或用类似方法加以保护。

value.def: If something unpleasant threatens to happen, it seems likely to happen.

partsOfSpeech.dec: fast adj.快速移动的 + -en 动词后缀
frignt + -en 动词后缀
hap 运气,机会 + -p- + -en 动词后缀

hard adj.坚实的 + -en 动词后缀
haste n.急速 + -en 动词后缀
less det.&pro.量更少 + -en 动词后缀
light n.光 + -en 动词后缀
loose adj.松动的 + -en 动词后缀
quick adj.快的 + -en 动词后缀
sharp adj.锋利的 + -en 动词后缀
strength n.力 + -en 动词后缀
weak adj.无力的 + -en 动词后缀

en- 进入,使… + light 光亮;点亮 + -en 动词后缀
